intro: Charistemma fastigiata, commonly known as the stiff-stemmed heath, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its upright, woody stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pink. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or coastal landscapes. Its foliage consists of narrow, evergreen leaves that provide year-round interest. Charistemma fastigiata is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance.
